summary: The United States Census of 1830 was the fifth Census in the United States.
full_text:
The United States Census of 1830, the fifth census undertaken in the United States, was conducted on June 1, 1830. The only loss of census records for 1830 involved some countywide losses in Massachusetts, Maryland, and Mississippi.
It determined the population of the 24 states to be 12,866,020, of which 2,009,043 were slaves. The center of population was about 170 miles  west of Washington, D.C. in present-day Grant County, West Virginia.
title: 1830 United States Census
